thread.title: Football: Zeug, MKA roll past Fieldston
thread.title_full: Football: Zeug, MKA roll past Fieldston

title: Football: Zeug, MKA roll past Fieldston
text:
Football: Zeug, MKA roll past Fieldston October 8, 2015 Last updated: Thursday, October 8, 2015, 12:31 AM The Montclair Times Print 
Quarterback Erik Zeug accounted for three touchdowns to lead the Montclair Kimberley Academy to a 42-13 win over the Fieldston School in Metropolitan Independent Football League action this past Saturday in the Bronx, N.Y. 
The Cougars (5-0, 3-0 MIFL) ran out to a 28-7 halftime lead behind a pair of short Ethan Fusco touchdown runs, a 30-yard scoring sprint by Rob Strain and Zeug’s 35-yard keeper run. 
In the second half, Zeug threw touchdown passes of 20 yards (to Strain) and 40 yards (to Ben Yanes) to close out MKA’s tally. The senior signal-caller finished the day 7-for-12 for 205 yards. 
Fusco ran for 142 yards, while Yanes caught 3 passes for 90 yards. 
Brian Bond led the Cougar defensive effort with 10 tackles and 4 sacks. 
MKA can clinch the MIFL title when it hosts the Hackley School on Oct. 17. 
The Cougars are next in action this Saturday, at 1:30 p.m., when they return to Van Brunt Field to host Morristown-Beard in a non-conference matchup. © 2015 North Jersey Media Group Tags:
